title: Americans: What (if any) high school film depicts real-life high school the best? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not a movie…a TV show.  I’ve been teaching for 21 years, and a good chunk of those years were in “rough” low-income schools. The most accurate depiction of what happens in those kinds of schools is from the HBO TV series …The Wire.  While the show is a crime drama, and a damn good one at that, a good chunk of Seaon 4 revolves around a former detective who takes a teaching position in the Baltimore public school system.  Also pivotal to the story development is the interaction and character development of a group of neglected, troubled and sometimes abused young men.  My wife and I both have experience teaching in “those kinds of neighborhoods” and teaching “those kinds of kids.” This was the first movie or TV depiction where we agreed that the writers really took the time to understand what’s going on in many American schools.

Definitely depends on the type of person one was in high school. My high school experience was like a mix of Dazed and Confused and Stand and Deliver, with a dose of Confessions of a Wallflower, from movies I’m familiar with (as there was a lot of drugs, gangs, and weird music depression for me in high school). Other people had more of a Friday Night Lights or Varsity Blues type. Some people had more of a Lean on Me type experience, or even the Breakfast Club or Dead Poets Society. America is filled with a wide variety of high school experiences due to region, culture, socio-economic status, race, etc.
